page.title: 01Torrin, Kilbride, Faoilean
page.content: A fair percentage of this block consists of uncultivated moor and hill grazing, but Kilbride has been fenced and has some cultivation; while the crofting township of Torrin consists of 18 crofts and a few other houses, here most of the land is fenced and cultivated on a subsistence level. Most of the houses are occupied but the crofters have to go to Broadford, 7 miles away for school, shops, medical treatment, entertainment etc. The main occupation is crofting, (sheep, cattle and their feed) with some tourism and a little forestry (Forestry Commission). There is a lime quarry (2) and marble quarry (7) employing in all 15 men. A fish farm has been started (1,5) salmon rearing tanks in the sea, and offices etc, at Faoilean, at present employing 5 men.
